content.description: A storm washed away sand from a beach, causing the edge of the water to get closer to a nearby road. The rate at which the distance between the road and the edge of the water was changing during the storm is modeled by \(f\left(t\right)=\sqrt{t}+\cos t-3\) meters per hour, t hours after the storm began. The edge of the water was 35 meters from the road when the storm began, and the storm lasted 5 hours. The derivative of f(t) is \(f'\left(t\right)=\frac{1}{2\sqrt{t}}-\sin t\).
content.question: At what time during the 5 hours of the storm was the distance between the road and the edge of the water decreasing most rapidly? Justify your answer.

frqParts.text: At what time during the 5 hours of the storm was the distance between the road and the edge of the water decreasing most rapidly? Justify your answer.

topic.text: 5.5: Using the Candidates Test to Determine Absolute (Global) Extrema

skill.text: Skill 1.E: Apply appropriate mathematical rules or procedures, with and without technology.
